description: Probably from Middle Dutch or Middle Low German schrimpen (“to shrivel up, wrinkle”), ultimately from Proto-Germanic *skrimpaną (“to shrink”), from Proto-Indo-European *(s)ker- (“to cut off”), related to Old English sċrimman (“to shrink”) and sċrincan (“to shrivel up”). Related to shrink, shrimp.

adjectives.description: scrimp (comparative more scrimp, superlative most scrimp)

verbs.description: scrimp (third-person singular simple present scrimps, present participle scrimping, simple past and past participle scrimped)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make too small or short.
examples: To scrimp the pattern of a coat.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To limit or straiten; to put on short allowance.
